name.description: List of keywords for SEO.
A concise description of the page for search engines.
Controls indexing and crawling by search engines.
Specifies the name of the author of the page.
Defines how the page should be displayed on mobile devices.
Indicates the software used to generate the page.
Specifies the interval after which search engines should revisit the page.
Indicates the content rating (e.g., General, Mature).
Defines the intended distribution of the document (e.g., Global, Local).
Displays copyright information for the page content.
Specifies the language of the content (e.g., 'en', 'fr').
Specifies the subject of the page.
Defines the geographical or temporal scope of the document.
Specifies the main topic of the page.
Provides a brief summary of the page content.
Specifies the intended rendering device (e.g., 'all', 'screen').
Indicates if the page is optimized for handheld devices.
Defines the width of the content for mobile optimization.
Specifies the date of publication or modification.
Defines the canonical URL of the page.
Specifies an email address for user feedback.
Specifies the URL of the page.
Specifies the name of the page designer.
Indicates the owner of the page.
Defines the Dublin Core title of the page.
Specifies the medium of the content (e.g., 'blog', 'news').
Specifies the original source of the syndicated content.
Indicates the original source URL of the content.

http-equiv.description: Defines the content type and character encoding of the page.
Specifies caching rules for the page.
Sets directives for caching; often used with 'no-cache'.
Specifies compatibility mode for Internet Explorer (e.g., 'IE=edge').
Sets a timer to refresh the page or redirect to another URL.
Defines rules for content security to prevent cross-site scripting (XSS) and other vulnerabilities.
Specifies the preferred stylesheet to use for the page.
Sends cookies from the server to the client in the response headers.
Forces browsers to use HTTPS connections to access the site.
Controls whether the browser should prefetch DNS queries for linked resources.
Prevents browsers from interpreting files as a different MIME type than declared (e.g., 'nosniff').
Prevents the page from being displayed in a frame or iframe to protect against clickjacking (e.g., 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN').
Defines how content can be loaded by cross-domain requests (e.g., 'none', 'master-only').
Controls the information sent in the Referer header when navigating to another page.
Enables experimental web platform features for a limited time.
Suggests safer download handling to prevent the execution of downloaded files (e.g., 'noopen').

property.description: Title used for social media sharing (Open Graph).
Description displayed during social sharing.
Link to the image used for social sharing.
Canonical URL of the page for Open Graph.
Type of content, such as 'article', 'website', or 'video'.
The locale of the page, such as 'en_US' or 'fr_FR'.
Name of the website as it should appear during sharing.
URL to a video file to represent the content.
MIME type of the video file (e.g., 'video/mp4').
Width of the video in pixels.
Height of the video in pixels.
Alternative text for the Open Graph image.
Width of the Open Graph image in pixels.
Height of the Open Graph image in pixels.
Author of the article, usually a link to a profile or social media.
Publication date and time of the article in ISO 8601 format.
Last modification date and time of the article in ISO 8601 format.
Section or category of the article (e.g., 'Technology').
Keywords or tags associated with the article.
Type of Twitter card to use (e.g., 'summary', 'summary_large_image').
Title of the content for Twitter cards.
Description of the content for Twitter cards.
URL of the image to display in Twitter cards.
Twitter username of the website or organization.
Twitter username of the content creator.
